conclusion: Analyze the given P-V diagram of the Stirling cycle to determine changes in thermal motion.
Processes A→B and C→D are isothermal; processes B→C and D→A involve changes in temperature or volume.
Isothermal processes occur at constant temperature.
Thermal motion does not change during isothermal processes A→B and C→D.
Process B→C is typically an isochoric expansion in the Stirling cycle.
For an isochoric process, volume remains constant but temperature typically increases.
Thermal motion intensity is directly related to the temperature of the gas.
As temperature increases during B→C, thermal motion becomes more intense.
